alert.note: Alert for Atascosa; Bexar; De Witt; Fayette; Gonzales; Guadalupe; Karnes; Kinney; Lavaca; Medina; Uvalde; Val Verde; Wilson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 03 at 2:27PM CST until February 04 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total sleet and snow accumulations of up to 1/2 inch and ice accumulations up to a tenth of an inch. In addition, winds could gust as high as 35 mph and produce wind chill values in the single digits through 9 AM Friday. * WHERE...Portions of south central Texas. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 9 PM CST this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 9 PM this evening to 9 AM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Difficult travel conditions are possible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Side walks and pavement could be slippery to walk on. In addition, a risk for hypothermia exists for those spending extended time outdoors and not dressed in layers and gloves. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavier icing greater than a tenth of an ice could occur for locations along and north of Loop 1604 in northern Bexar County.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state can be obtained at drivetexas.org.
